data.title: Human Rights Forum - Shared Society in a Time of War
data.meta_description: A human rights forum called, "Shared Society in a Time of War: Interreligious Voices from Israel."
data.text:
GHADIR HANI was born in Acre, spent about 22 years in the Negev in the field of tourism, community relations and women's empowerment, returned to Acre in 2021 and since then has been working at a social center in Arabic at the Mediation Center in Acre. Finance manager of the movement "Stand Together," member of the board of directors of the Albachor Association for the Promotion of Early Childhood, the Arab friend in the Negev.

‏Active in several organizations for peace and common life. A member of the Roach Galit interfaith group of leaders, she was a member of the steering team of the Friends Making Peace movement and is currently a member of the movement's leadership, leader of the Standing together movement, activist for unrecognized settlements and villages in the Negev, mothers on guard, another voice movement, the interfaith initiative in the Negev, member of the board of directors of Hagar Owners, member of the people association - Arab women's forum in the Negev in the fight against women, polygamy and more.

‏A graduate of the uniqueness and togetherness program in the Tikkun movement, a graduate of the Heshel Center for Sustainability's fellows program, manager of a platform (a Facebook page called Al-Hima-Al-Manbar) where content on a variety of topics related to religion and of course current political issues are uploaded.

‏In 2018, she won the Sami Michael Award, and was among the 50 heroines and heroes among Yedioth Ahronoth's activities and social activists, 2020 Israeli Hope Award.

‏In 2020, she was chosen by Yedioth HaNegev as one of the twenty most influential people in the Negev in the last 20 years. In 2021, she was chosen by the feminist cell and the student association in Ben Gurion as one of the 10 most influential people on campus and in the surrounding area.
